content.description:
I would not consider this an OW climb.  Less than stellar pro up easier climbing over some vegetation into a hand crack that goes to fist through the crux bulge.  This is much more fun than

Thin Crack

.  This one can be set up as a TR.
content.protection: Bring runners, some TCU-sized cams, Camalots sizes: 1 #4, 2 #2s, and 2 #3s.
content.location: This is the wider of the two cracks on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Run it out moving to the left to a tree you can sling.  From there, you can go up into a dirty crack that begins to bulge.  Pull the bulge and climb up a smaller crack, the only good rock on the route, to a couple of glue-in bolts.  Can be set up as a TR.
content.protection: Runners.  Doubles of Camalots #0.75-2.  You could probably take more, but it isn't very sustained.
content.location: This is the left crack and first route approached on Ken's Face.

content.description: This is a nice change to the usual X Rock affair, a long face climb that makes you think on solid rock. The crux is at the ancient bolt.
content.protection: Although potentially leadable, probably better done as just a top rope off of the two bolt anchor and chains at the top.
content.location: This is the face between thin crack and wide crack. There is an ancient bolt about halfway up the climb.
